Package fr.sorbonne_u.datacenter.hardware.computers.interfaces

Interface ComputerServicesI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentServiceI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputerServicesConnector, ComputerServicesInboundPort, ComputerServicesOutboundPort
    public interface ComputerServicesI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredI
    The interface ComputerServicesI defines the services offered by Computer components (allocating cores).

    Description

    TODO: add the deallocation of cores.

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : April 9, 2015

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Computer.AllocatedCore allocateCore()
      allocate one core on this computer and return an instance of AllocatedCore containing the processor number, the core number and a map giving the URI of the processor inbound ports; return null if no core is available.
      Computer.AllocatedCore allocateCore​(int processorNo, int coreNo)
      allocate the core (processorNo, coreNo) on this computer and return an instance of AllocatedCore containing the processor number, the core number and a map giving the URI of the processor inbound ports; return null if no core is available.
      Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocateCores​(int numberRequested)
      allocate up to numberRequested cores on this computer and return and array of AllocatedCore containing the data for each requested core; return an empty array if no core is available.
      void releaseCore​(Computer.AllocatedCore ac)
      releases a priorly reserved core.
      void releaseCores​(Computer.AllocatedCore[] acs)
      release an array of priorly reserved cores.

        Computer.AllocatedCore allocateCore()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        allocate one core on this computer and return an instance of AllocatedCore containing the processor number, the core number and a map giving the URI of the processor inbound ports; return null if no core is available.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        an instance of AllocatedCore with the data about the allocated core.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.

      • allocateCores

        Computer.AllocatedCore[] allocateCores​(int numberRequested)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        allocate up to numberRequested cores on this computer and return and array of AllocatedCore containing the data for each requested core; return an empty array if no core is available.

        Contract

         pre    numberRequested > 0
 post   return.length >= 0 and return.length <= numberRequested
        Parameters:
        numberRequested - number of cores to be allocated.
        Returns:
        an array of instances of AllocatedCore with the data about the allocated cores.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.

      • releaseCore

        void releaseCore​(Computer.AllocatedCore ac)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        releases a priorly reserved core.

        Contract

         pre    this.isReserved(ac.processorNo, ac.coreNo) ;
 post   !this.isReserved(ac.processorNo, ac.coreNo) ;
        Parameters:
        ac - priorly allocated core data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.
